name: wp secure
author: jremillard

sections.description:
Welcome to the WP-Secure Plugin for WordPress – By SiteSecurityMonitor.com. We have provided this plugin free of charge to the WordPress community! We developed this solution initially for our customers – and decided to release it to the community. We have found over time that the same basic issues confound our users, and that basic WordPress security settings are not being applied. So, we developed this plugin to make it real simple for everyone involved! We hope you enjoy it, and provide any feedback as to features, changes, bugs.

To date, the plugin performs these functions:

General Security Checks

upgrade to the last version of wordpress
check plugins that are out of date

Reduce Vulnerability Risks From Your WordPress Blog

Remove error information on login-page
Hide your wordpress version(frontend)
Hide your wordpress version(dashboard)
Remove really simple discovery
Remove Windows Live Writer
Remove core update information
Remove plugin update information
Remove theme update information

Enhance Security For Your WordPress

Add index.php for plugin directory
Hide your plugins folder
Change the default admin username
–> Test the strength of your password
Restrict access to wp-config.php file
Restrict access to wp-includes folder
Restrict access to wp-content folder
Restrict wp-admin for only your Ip
–> Restrict access to wp-admin Manual
–> Check files and folder permissions
Get a free malware scan from SSM
sections.installation:
1. Click on ‘Plugins’, ‘Add New’, ‘Upload’.
    • Browse for the wp-secure.zip file, upload it.
  2. Activate it, and then click on ‘WP Secure by SSM’
  3. Now you are ready to start the lockdown process. Click on the ‘Process’ Menu link to get started!
sections.faq:
What about malware and vulnerability management?

This plugin does the basics of wordpress lockdown to help fend off attackers. We recommend regular scanning and detection of your site to ‘ensure’ that you are protected. You can get started with your first free scan on the ‘Security Seal’ tab of the plugin.
